panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together
panels.title: CPU Busy

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="system"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="user"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="iowait"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode=~".*irq"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode!='idle',mode!='user',mode!='system',mode!='iowait',mode!='irq',mode!='softirq'}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.description: Disk space used of all filesystems mounted
panels.title: Disk Space Used Basic

panels.description: The number of bytes read from or written to the device per second
panels.title: Disk R/W Data

matcher.options: Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="system"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: System - Processes executing in kernel mode

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="user"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: User - Normal processes executing in user mode

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="nice"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="iowait"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="irq"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="softirq"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="steal"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Idle - Waiting for something to happen

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes
Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Committed_AS - Amount of memory presently allocated on the system
CommitLimit - Amount of  memory currently available to be allocated on the system

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Inactive_file - File-backed memory on inactive LRU list
Inactive_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)
Active_file - File-backed memory on active LRU list
Active_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.expr: node_memory_MemTotal_bytes - node_memory_MemFree_bytes - node_memory_Buffers_bytes - node_memory_Cached_bytes - node_memory_Slab_bytes - node_memory_PageTables_bytes - node_memory_SwapCached_bytes
targets.legendFormat: Apps - Memory used by user-space applications
PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses
SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified
Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)
Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache
Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
